column5: TEXT
Hello… Who might you be?
column6: My name is *name*. I'm here to take part in the contest

column5: *name*… You’re Adelaide’s granddaughter?
Well, obviously you can't join. You're not qualified.

column6: What can I do to enter?

column5: Well…. Bring me my favourite wine - Chateau Margaux 1982 - I might reconsider…
column6: But how am I supposed to get it!?
A bribe? You gotta be kidding

column5: Well well, you actually found my wine! Stunning! Give it to me. Now there are just a few thing we have to wrap up.
There are some minor preparations left here on set. And you, as a participant, shall also need truffles.
Since you’re so eager to take part in the contest, you need to talk to Monique about these mushrooms. And help me, naturally.
column6: What do I need to do?

column5: You can first find some tasty juicy fruits for our guests
What do you want? Read the sign, we’re closed.
Truffles she needs! Bonbon‘s health is my only concern right now. He is terribly, terribly sick. Get out!
Oh, you really want to help? That is so sweet of you! What did you say your name was?
*name*, thank you! Could you go and get my little Bonbon a blanket? I’d go myself, but I can’t leave him, I just can’t!
Oh, you have it! Now you’ll be warm, sweet Bonbon! But he is still sick! I don’t know what to do! I’m going to faint, ah!
How? Oh, what if he’s dying? What am I gonna do without him! I’ll die too!

column6: He looks better already, don’t panic!

column5: Maybe… Yes! We should get him some medicine. That will help, I hope. I can only hope now!
column6: Don’t worry, I’ll get the medicine

column5: Hello *name*! I hear you have some hardship entering the contest. I can help you.

column6: How do you know my name?

column5: Let’s just say, I’m a friend of your granny. But more importantly I hold a certain sway over Julien.

column6: What would you want for it?

column5: Quid pro quo. You give me things, I give you favors. There are some items you can help me acquire.
Choice is all yours, *name*. But the first thing I’ll need is a basket
Oh, I see you took up my offer, *name*. Well, thank you.
column6: I just hope it’s not a trick

column5: This will really help me. So… let’s see what’s next on my list...
We should switch to something more complex or we might get bored. We don’t want that, do we, *name*? Bring me a nice sharp saw.
Well-well, the fruits’ are… fine. I guess you can handle simple tasks
But there's more to do, I hope you understand. You understand, right?
I’ll pretend I believe you. The second thing we need is a nice tablecloth set for our guest tables.
This tablecloth actually looks good. You have some taste, shocker!
column6: You think very little of me, huh?

column5: But! The fruit you’ve got is not enough!

column6: Well, I guess I didn’t bring much

column5: Exactly! Go get more fruits. And get some wine to serve too, and please don’t screw this up!
Oh, he seems to be feeling better! Thank you so much! What would I have done without you. You saved my baby!
But I think now that he’s recovering, we should help him get better
He needs more nutrients! We need to cook up my special piggy food for him. Would you bring some ingredients?
Bonbon loved the food so much! You’re a treasure, where have been all my life!
I think when you came, you mentioned truffles. Did Julien send you? If we want any truffles, we first have to replace my basket
I can't find it anywhere. And, naturally, I can’t go without it..
Hmmm, this saw is acceptable. It should do for my needs…
Certainly. Nothing of value comes easily, *name*
Nothing too taxing, however. I need a few meters of wires and a nice handy knife
Excellent! You see, we make up quite a team
column6: But I still don’t know what we are doing
I’m just in it for your help

column5: Fair enough. Could you bring me some food? Fruit, perhaps?

column6: Bet it’s for you evil plan as well

column5: I’m offended, *name*. Do you think I don’t eat? An apple a day and all that.
Fruits and wine in place? Good job! Give me a high five!
What else do we need. Lemme check. Right! A fine set of plates for our participants, you included, to serve up their masterpieces.
Well, these plates are actually fancy. I am starting to think there is something in you.
Now to the cherry on our cake of a competition. We need flower garlands to crown our winners at the end. Something beautiful!

column6: Where do you get these ideas??

column5: I saw something like that when I was hosting in London. They were simply beautiful! And elegant! We totally need it! Go-go!
Oh this basket is even better than the one I had! But if we want any truffles, Bonbon should be dressed for the forest.
A new costume is what he needs. Yes-yes, cute and comfortable! Can you bring me one, *name*?

column6: Weird is becoming the new normal…

column5: This costume is so so cute! And it matches my hiking outfit! Perfect, just perfect!

column6: Can we talk about truffles now?

column5: Ohoh, truffles! We are coming! Wait! We'll have to eat out there in the forest, right? Could you prepare a picnic basket for us?
Oh, what a pretty basket you’ve brought! And you totally got everything we need in it. Now we can go truffle-hunting with my baby Bonbon!
These were actually fairly tasty, thank you.
Now off to something more entertaining! I really need a decent camera. With tripod. Not a challenge for you, right, *name*?

column6: You are making these up to taunt me?

column5: Hm, you have some technical expertise, *name*. It’d be quite something to know you in private life…
column6: Why do you need those things?

column5: That really none of your business, *name*. My next request is very much your business, however.
I need some very specific pills. I wrote the name for you. Please don’t mess it up, *name*.
Well-well… That was the last item on my list. You did quite well, *name*. Better, than I expected
I gave you my word, did I not? I shall speak to Julien and… Persuade him…
Oh man, these garlands are awesome! Simple and beautiful! I like your idea to use lavender, adds a local vibe and excellent smell!

column6: I did my best given the circumstances

column5: But a litte, almost tiny, problem arose....
The microphone I planned on using at the competition is dead. I need a new one. Be quick, we have to test it before the event!

column6: You should be more careful with your stuff

column5: Oh good, the new mic. That’s much better. I hope the quality’s good, or there’ll be consequences

column6: Can we get back to the competition now?

column5: While you were gone I realized you've only brought the plates. And what about silver cutlery?
column6: But you’ve only asked for plates!
I brought what you asked for

column5: Nonsense! When I say tableware I mean everything one needs to set the table! Forks and knives included.
If you don’t understand such simple things there is no place for you at my competition!
column6: Okay, I’ll bring cutlery as well
No need to be rude, I’m going

column5: See, it’s easy if you want it. As I predicted, you amateurs are too slow for gourmet cuisine. But I’ll give you one last chance.
I want the mayor to sit on special chair. After all, HE dragged me to this dump. We shall pay tribute.

column6: What do I have to do with it?

column5: What do you mean? Go get me the chair. And saw it thoroughly!
Perfect. We’re gonna rock this town, baby! Seems you’re not that dumb. Forgive my honesty. You’re not easily offended, right? We’re cool?
Great, great! Then go, prepare for the contest, it’s gonna be big!
So, you have your moment of glory ahead of you, *name*? Let me give you a piece of advice.
Not so fast, *name*. Quid pro quo, remember?
One last thing. I could really use a shovel.
column6: Yes, of course, I’ll get it

column5: Thank you, *name*. And my advice is simple: believe no one. Your path will be more tangled than you can possibly imagine.
Now it’s time for you to fly to Paris, little *name*, fly, fly, fly…
